application-name.label: Application Name
application-name.hint: Identifies a group of forms (for example "acme" or "sales")
application-name.help:
The application name is a name which allows grouping form together. The application name (or app name) can be, for example:

  • a company name such as "orbeon" or "acme"
  • a company entity such as "hr" or "sales" or "engineering"
  • a project name such as "mercury" or "phoenix"

This name shows in the URL of the deployed form, so we recommend you use only lowercase characters.
application-name.alert: Use a maximum of 255 ASCII letters, digits, "-" or "_"

form-name.label: Form Name
form-name.help:
The Form name is a name which is local to an application name, for example "address" or "claim".

This name shows in the URL, so we recommend you use only lowercase characters.
form-name.alert: Use a maximum of 255 ASCII letters, digits, "-" or "_"
form-name.no-form-alert: No form with this specific application and form name in this system have been found in this system.

visibility.label: Visibility
visibility.help:
This allows you to specify whether the form control is visible or not.

  • Yes: The form control is visible.
  • No: The form control is hidden.
  • Formula: The form control is visible or hidden dynamically depending on a formula.

The formula allows you to dynamically specify whether the form control is visible or not. It must return a boolean value. The form control is visible if the formula evaluates to true(), and hidden if it evaluates to false().

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their name preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

readonly.label: Read-Only
readonly.help:
This allows you to specify whether the form control is readonly or read-write.

  • Yes: The form control is readonly.
  • No: The form control is read-write.
  • Formula: The form control is readonly or read-write dynamically depending on a formula.

The formula allows you to dynamically specify whether the form control is readonly or read-write. It must return a boolean value. The form control is readonly if the formula evaluates to true(), and read-write if it evaluates to false().

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their name preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

default.label: Initial Value
default.help:
This formula allows you to specify an initial value for the form control in "new" mode only.

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their name preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

calculate.label: Calculated Value
calculate.help:
This formula allows you to specify a calculated value for the form control. This value is re-evaluated to remain up to date as needed.

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their name preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

dialog-publish.create-new-version-help: PLEASE NOTE: Publishing this form definition will create a new version of the form definition in the database. Data which already exists in the database will still be viewed and edited with the previous versions of this form definition which are associated with that data. The new form definition version will be used to create new data.
dialog-publish.overwrite-version-help: PLEASE NOTE: This will overwrite the existing form definition. If the changes you have made to the form definition are small, such as changing control labels, the form definition will be compatible with existing form data. But if you have made structural changes, such as adding, removing, renaming, or moving controls, the form definition might be incompatible with existing data. We recommend being careful when overwriting an existing form definition version.

visibility.label: Synlighet
visibility.help:
This allows you to specify whether the form control is visible or not.

  • Yes: The form control is visible.
  • No: The form control is hidden.
  • Formula: The form control is visible or hidden dynamically depending on a formula.

The formula allows you to dynamically specify whether the form control is visible or not. It must return a boolean value. The form control is visible if the formula evaluates to true(), and hidden if it evaluates to false().

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

readonly.label: Skrivebeskyttelse
readonly.help:
This allows you to specify whether the form control is readonly or read-write.

  • Yes: The form control is readonly.
  • No: The form control is read-write.
  • Formula: The form control is readonly or read-write dynamically depending on a formula.

The formula allows you to dynamically specify whether the form control is readonly or read-write. It must return a boolean value. The form control is readonly if the formula evaluates to true(), and read-write if it evaluates to false().

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

default.label: ForhÃ¥ndsutfylt verdi
default.help:
This formula allows you to specify an initial value for the form control in "new" mode only.

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

calculate.label: Utregnet verdi
calculate.help:
This formula allows you to specify a calculated value for the form control. This value is re-evaluated to remain up to date as needed.

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

dialog-publish.create-new-version-help: PLEASE NOTE: Publishing this form definition will create a new version of the form definition in the database. Data which already exists in the database will still be viewed and edited with the previous versions of this form definition which are associated with that data. The new form definition version will be used to create new data.
dialog-publish.overwrite-version-help: PLEASE NOTE: This will overwrite the existing form definition. If the changes you have made to the form definition are small, such as changing control labels, the form definition will be compatible with existing form data. But if you have made structural changes, such as adding, removing, renaming, or moving controls, the form definition might be incompatible with existing data. We recommend being careful when overwriting an existing form definition version.

We recommend being careful when overwriting an existing form definition version.

application-name.help:
Il nome dell'applicazione consente di raggruppare i moduli.

Esempi: un nome aziendale ("orbeon", "acme"), un reparto ("hr", "vendite"), oppure un progetto ("mercury").

Questo nome compare nell'URL del modulo pubblicato; si consiglia di usare solo minuscole.
application-name.alert: Utilizza un massimo di 255 lettere ASCII, cifre, "-" o "_"

visibility.label: VisibiltÃ
visibility.help:
Consente di specificare se il controllo del modulo Ã¨ visibile oppure no.

  • SÃ¬: Il controllo Ã¨ visibile.
  • No: Il controllo Ã¨ nascosto.
  • Formula: La visibilitÃ  Ã¨ determinata dinamicamente da una formula.

La formula deve restituire un valore booleano: il controllo Ã¨ visibile se la formula vale true() e nascosto se vale false().

Puoi fare riferimento ad altri controlli usando i loro nomi preceduti dal simbolo $; digitando $ viene mostrato l'elenco dei controlli disponibili.

Per maggiori informazioni sulle formule, consulta la documentazione di Form Builder.

readonly.label: Solo lettura
readonly.help:
Consente di specificare se il controllo Ã¨ in sola lettura oppure modificabile.

  • SÃ¬: Il controllo Ã¨ in sola lettura.
  • No: Il controllo Ã¨ in lettura/scrittura.
  • Formula: Lo stato Ã¨ determinato dinamicamente da una formula.

La formula deve restituire un booleano: true() per sola lettura, false() per lettura/scrittura.

Ãˆ possibile fare riferimento ad altri controlli con $nomeControllo; digitando $ viene mostrato l'elenco dei controlli disponibili.

Per maggiori informazioni, vedi la documentazione di Form Builder.

default.label: Valore iniziale
default.help:
Consente di specificare un valore iniziale per il controllo, solo in modalitÃ  "nuovo".

Nella formula puoi riferirti ad altri controlli con $ seguito dal loro nome; digitando $ viene mostrato l'elenco dei controlli.

Per maggiori dettagli consulta la documentazione di Form Builder.

calculate.label: Valore calcolato
calculate.help:
Consente di specificare un valore calcolato per il controllo. Il valore viene rivalutato automaticamente quando necessario.

Puoi riferirti ad altri controlli con $ seguito dal nome del controllo; digitando $ viene mostrato l'elenco dei controlli.

Per ulteriori informazioni, vedi la documentazione di Form Builder.

dialog-publish.create-new-version-help: NOTA: La pubblicazione di questa definizione di modulo creerÃ una nuova versione della definizione del modulo nel database. I dati che esistono giÃ nel database potranno ancora essere visualizzati e modificati con le versioni precedenti di questa definizione del modulo che sono associati con tali dati. La nuova versione della definizione del modulo verrÃ utilizzata per creare nuovi dati.
dialog-publish.overwrite-version-help: NOTA: Questo sovrascriverÃ la definizione di modulo esistente. Se le modifiche apportate alla definizione di modulo sono piccole, come cambiare le etichette di controllo, la definizione del modulo sarÃ compatibile con i dati del modulo esistente. Ma se sono state apportate modifiche strutturali, come l'aggiunta, la rimozione, la ridenominazione, o il movimento dei controlli, la definizione di modulo potrebbe essere incompatibile con i dati esistenti. Si consiglia di essere attentiti quando sovrascrive una versione della definizione di modulo esistente.

Die Formel muss einen booleschen Wert liefern. Das Steuerelement ist sichtbar, wenn die Formel true() ergibt, und verborgen, wenn sie false() ergibt.

visibility.label: NÃ¤kyvyys
visibility.help:
This allows you to specify whether the form control is visible or not.

  • Yes: The form control is visible.
  • No: The form control is hidden.
  • Formula: The form control is visible or hidden dynamically depending on a formula.

The formula allows you to dynamically specify whether the form control is visible or not. It must return a boolean value. The form control is visible if the formula evaluates to true(), and hidden if it evaluates to false().

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

readonly.label: Vain luku
readonly.help:
This allows you to specify whether the form control is readonly or read-write.

  • Yes: The form control is readonly.
  • No: The form control is read-write.
  • Formula: The form control is readonly or read-write dynamically depending on a formula.

The formula allows you to dynamically specify whether the form control is readonly or read-write. It must return a boolean value. The form control is readonly if the formula evaluates to true(), and read-write if it evaluates to false().

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

default.label: AlkuperÃ¤inen arvo
default.help:
This formula allows you to specify an initial value for the form control in "new" mode only.

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

calculate.label: Laskettu arvo
calculate.help:
This formula allows you to specify a calculated value for the form control. This value is re-evaluated to remain up to date as needed.

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

visibility.label: Visibilidad
visibility.help:
This allows you to specify whether the form control is visible or not.

  • Yes: The form control is visible.
  • No: The form control is hidden.
  • Formula: The form control is visible or hidden dynamically depending on a formula.

The formula allows you to dynamically specify whether the form control is visible or not. It must return a boolean value. The form control is visible if the formula evaluates to true(), and hidden if it evaluates to false().

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

readonly.label: SÃ³lo-Lectura
readonly.help:
This allows you to specify whether the form control is readonly or read-write.

  • Yes: The form control is readonly.
  • No: The form control is read-write.
  • Formula: The form control is readonly or read-write dynamically depending on a formula.

The formula allows you to dynamically specify whether the form control is readonly or read-write. It must return a boolean value. The form control is readonly if the formula evaluates to true(), and read-write if it evaluates to false().

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

default.label: Valor Inicial
default.help:
This formula allows you to specify an initial value for the form control in "new" mode only.

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

calculate.label: Valor Calculado
calculate.help:
This formula allows you to specify a calculated value for the form control. This value is re-evaluated to remain up to date as needed.

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

dialog-publish.create-new-version-help: MERK OP: Publiceren van deze formdefinitie maakt een nieuwe versie van de formdefinitie in de database. Bestaande gegevens in de database kunnen nog wel met de vorige versies van deze formdefinitie waaraan deze zijn gkeoppeld, worden bekeken en bewerkt. De nieuwe versie van de formdefinitie wordt gebruikt om nieuwe gegevens te maken.
dialog-publish.overwrite-version-help: MERK OP: Hiermee overschrijft u de bestaande formdefnitie. Als de wijzigingen die u in de formdefinitie hebt gedaan klein zijn, zoals wijzigingen in control-labels, dan zal de formdefinitie compatibel zijn met bestaande formgegevens. Als u echter structuurwijzigingen hebt gedaan, zoals het toevoegen, verwijderen, hernoemen, of verplaatsen van controls, dan is de formdefinitie mogelijk incompatibel met bestaande gegevens. We raden u aan om voorzichtig te zijn bij het overschrijven van bestaande versies van formdefinities.

visibility.label: Visibilidade
visibility.help:
This allows you to specify whether the form control is visible or not.

  • Yes: The form control is visible.
  • No: The form control is hidden.
  • Formula: The form control is visible or hidden dynamically depending on a formula.

The formula allows you to dynamically specify whether the form control is visible or not. It must return a boolean value. The form control is visible if the formula evaluates to true(), and hidden if it evaluates to false().

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

readonly.label: Apenas Leitura
readonly.help:
This allows you to specify whether the form control is readonly or read-write.

  • Yes: The form control is readonly.
  • No: The form control is read-write.
  • Formula: The form control is readonly or read-write dynamically depending on a formula.

The formula allows you to dynamically specify whether the form control is readonly or read-write. It must return a boolean value. The form control is readonly if the formula evaluates to true(), and read-write if it evaluates to false().

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

default.label: Valor Inicial
default.help:
This formula allows you to specify an initial value for the form control in "new" mode only.

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

calculate.label: Valor Calculado
calculate.help:
This formula allows you to specify a calculated value for the form control. This value is re-evaluated to remain up to date as needed.

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

The formula allows you to dynamically specify whether the form control is readonly or read-write. It must return a boolean value. The form control is readonly if the formula evaluates to true(), and read-write if it evaluates to false().

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

default.help:
This formula allows you to specify an initial value for the form control in "new" mode only.

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.

calculate.label: BerÃ¤knat vÃ¤rde
calculate.help:
This formula allows you to specify a calculated value for the form control. This value is re-evaluated to remain up to date as needed.

You can refer to other form controls in the formula using their names preceded by a $ sign. When entering the $ sign, a list of available form controls is displayed.

For more about formulas, see the Form Builder documentation.
